intro: Hedyotis quocensis, commonly known as the Quoc mountain geranium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pink, and its opposite, ovate leaves. Hedyotis quocensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of interest for botanists studying plant biodiversity.
